catalog_info.title: Race, Class and the Making of American Religion
catalog_info.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 2599.
catalog_info.description: This class explores the ways in which both race and class are implicated in the development and practice of religion in the U.S. Through historical, anthropological and sociological works we explore the theoretical underpinnings of race and class and ponder their influence upon varying expressions of Islam, Judaism and Christianity.
